summary: Dr. Sanjeev Singhal, a psychiatrist, was found guilty of immoral and unprofessional conduct for engaging in a sexual relationship with a former psychiatric patient's spouse, exploiting patient information obtained during treatment, and having inappropriate social interactions. He also sent a blaming text message to the former patient after a complaint was filed. The Maryland State Board of Physicians reprimanded him, suspended his license for a minimum of six months, mandated enrollment in a rehabilitation program, and required a professionalism course, followed by two years of probation.
